intro: Johannia elegans, commonly known as the elegant Johannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
